Episodes.Title: Fade Out, Fade In
Episodes.Writer: James Fritzell, Everett Greenbaum, Ken Levine
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Frank Burns cracks up over Margaret's marriage while on R&R in Tokyo, and Major Charles Emerson Winchester III is sent to the 4077th as a replacement by a vindictive superior officer.

Episodes.Title: Fallen Idol
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Radar has always looked up to Hawkeye and admired him as his hero. But after suffering a Jeep accident en route to R&R at Hawkeye's behest, Radar questions his own hero worship - particularly when he and his hero have a falling-out.

Episodes.Title: Last Laugh
Episodes.Writer: Everett Greenbaum, James Fritzell, Ken Levine
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A practical joking friend gets BJ into serious trouble when he is arrested for a run-in he supposedly had with a general in Seoul.

Episodes.Title: War of Nerves
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Sidney Freedman feels depressed over Tom, a young soldier, who blames Sidney for his injuries because Sidney sent him back into combat. The 4077th members light a bonfire to release their stress.

Episodes.Title: The Winchester Tapes
Episodes.Writer: Everett Greenbaum, James Fritzell, Ken Levine
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye tries to travel to Seoul in order to visit Nurse Gilmore for the weekend. Charles tapes an angry message to his influential parents back home in Boston, asking for their help in getting him reassigned stateside.

Episodes.Title: The Light That Failed
Episodes.Writer: Burt Prelutsky, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A delivery error keeps the 4077th from receiving a vital shipment of supplies, Winchester has a selfish reaction to an error that nearly kills a patient, and everyone is forced to guess at the murderer's identity in a mystery novel.

Episodes.Title: In Love and War
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Despite Colonel Potter's warning, Hawkeye falls in love with a Korean villager. Meanwhile, Margaret learns that her husband Donald may have made a pass at a new nurse assigned to the 4077th.

Episodes.Title: Change Day
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Winchester plots to cheat the natives when the Army changes the military scrip while Klinger tries to attempt to apply to West Point in order to drop out later.

Episodes.Title: Images
Episodes.Writer: Burt Prelutsky, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Radar wants to get a tattoo, which Hawkeye and B.J. try to discourage. Major Houlihan wants to transfer one of her nurses out because she is too emotional for the job.

Episodes.Title: The M*A*S*H Olympics
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When Col. Potter decides the 4077th personnel are out of shape, he orders them to exercise. To motivate them, he comes up with the idea for a series of competitions like the Olympics, with the prize being a 3-day pass.

Episodes.Title: The Grim Reaper
Episodes.Writer: Burt Prelutsky, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Colonel Bloodworth threatens to press court-martial charges against Hawkeye, who shoved him in the bar. But then he becomes a patient and witnesses Hawkeye's skills. Klinger bonds with a patient from his hometown.

Episodes.Title: Comrades in Arms: Part 1
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye and Margaret become romantically involved while they are trapped behind enemy lines.

Episodes.Title: Comrades in Arms: Part 2
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: B.J. disobeys orders and goes out to find Hawkeye and Margaret, who are still missing in action. Meanwhile, their romantic relationship quickly goes up in flames, and they become even more hostile toward each other.

Episodes.Title: The Merchant of Korea
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: B.J. and Hawkeye are fed up with doing favors for Winchester because they owe him money. So they challenge him to a poker game to win it back.

Episodes.Title: The Smell of Music
Episodes.Writer: James Fritzell, Everett Greenbaum, Ken Levine
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye and B.J. refuse to shower until Charles stops playing his French horn, and Colonel Potter deals with a patient who wants to kill himself because he is now disfigured.

Episodes.Title: Patent 4077
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye is fed up with having to work with inadequate surgical equipment, so he tries to find somebody to create a makeshift clamp for him. And Klinger tries to find Margaret's wedding ring after it was accidentally thrown out wit...

Episodes.Title: Tea and Empathy
Episodes.Writer: Bill Idelson, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Father Mulcahy and Klinger retrieve some stolen penicillin after a soldier's confession, B.J. deals with a patient's morphine addiction, and British Major Ross demands that Hawkeye release his still-injured soldiers.

Episodes.Title: Your Hit Parade
Episodes.Writer: Ronny Graham, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: As the unit becomes overrun with casualties and tempers flare, Radar tries to raise everyone's spirits by playing new records over the intercom.

Episodes.Title: What's Up, Doc?
Episodes.Writer: Larry Balmagia, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye conducts a rabbit test on Radar's bunny to find out if Margaret is pregnant, and a patient desperate to get home holds Winchester hostage.

Episodes.Title: Mail Call Three
Episodes.Writer: Everett Greenbaum, James Fritzell, Ken Levine
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Klinger's wife wants a divorce, Radar's upset because his mom is seeing a new man, B.J. finds out that another man made a pass at his wife, and Hawkeye receives another love letter for another soldier named Benjamin Pierce.

Episodes.Title: Temporary Duty
Episodes.Writer: Larry Balmagia, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The 4077th and the 8063rd exchange Hawkeye and a nurse for a crude bumpkin surgeon and a personal friend of Margaret.

Episodes.Title: Potter's Retirement
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When Col. Potter learns of an informant feeding negative reports on his command bad enough to prompt an outside inspection, he decides to retire.

Episodes.Title: Dr. Winchester and Mr. Hyde
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Ronny Graham
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: While dealing with a long stretch of surgery duty, Winchester gets addicted to amphetamines. And Radar sets up a mouse race competition between the 4077th and a group of cocky Marine patients.

Episodes.Title: Major Topper
Episodes.Writer: Allyn Freeman, Ken Levine, David Isaacs
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Between the Swamp-mates trying to top each other, the camp deals with a bad batch of morphine and a corporal who shoots down invisible enemy gliders.
